com.vmware.vcenter.tokenservice

Interface TokenExchange

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, TokenExchangeTypes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TokenExchangeStub
    Deprecated. 
    As of release vSphere API 7.0.2.0.

    @Deprecated
public interface TokenExchange
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, TokenExchangeTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The TokenExchange interface provides possibility to exchange between different tokens types. Implementation of "OAuth 2.0 Token Exchange" standard (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-token-exchange-12).

    This interface has been deprecated in the vSphere 7.0 U2 release. Use com.vmware.vcenter.authentication.Token instead.

      TokenExchange.ExchangeInvocation exchange(TokenExchangeTypes.ExchangeSpec spec)
      Deprecated. 

    • Method Detail

      • exchange

        @Deprecated
TokenExchange.ExchangeInvocation exchange(TokenExchangeTypes.ExchangeSpec spec)
        Deprecated. 
        Exchanges incoming token based on the spec and current client authorization data.

        This method has been deprecated in the vSphere 7.0 U2 release. Use com.vmware.vcenter.authentication.Token#issue instead.

        Invocation Result:
        TokenExchangeTypes.Info class that contains new token.

        Parameters:
        spec - ExchangeSpec class contains arguments that define exchange process.
        Returns:
        instance of TokenExchange.ExchangeInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described exchange operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        InvalidRequest
        InvalidRequest
        InvalidGrant - provided authorization grant (e.g., authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.
        InvalidScope - If the server is unwilling or unable to issue a token for all the target services indicated by the TokenExchangeTypes.ExchangeSpec.getResource() or TokenExchangeTypes.ExchangeSpec.getAudience() parameters.
        Unauthorized - if authorization is not given to a caller.
